cap1.title: Multi-Source Data Fusion
cap1.description: This capability integrates data from multiple sources to create a unified safety view. It's the foundation of the safety ecosystem.
cap1.formula: Real-time data ingestion from N sources = Σ(sensor_i × weight_i + camera_j × confidence_j + process_k × frequency_k)
cap1.whyThisFormula: Weighted sum ensures important sources contribute more. Time-synchronization prevents data mismatches.
cap1.dataSources: IoT sensors (temperature, pressure, vibration), CCTV/thermal cameras, SCADA/PLC systems, maintenance logs, environmental monitors.
cap1.whereToGetData: Sensors deployed throughout facility, existing camera infrastructure, process control systems, maintenance databases.
cap1.whatToGetFrom: Real-time readings, historical patterns, calibration status, equipment metadata, location information.
cap1.logic: Correlation of disparate data reveals hidden patterns. Multiple sources provide redundancy if one fails.
cap1.otherLogic: Could use Bayesian networks, federated learning across sites, or edge processing before cloud aggregation.
cap1.purpose: Eliminate data silos, enable holistic safety monitoring, detect complex multi-factor hazards.

cap2.title: Human-in-Loop Decision Support
cap2.description: AI recommendations with human validation, creating a symbiotic relationship between automation and human judgment.
cap2.whyThisFormula: 60% weight to AI ensures efficiency, 30% to human maintains oversight, 10% to history provides learning.
cap2.dataSources: AI model outputs, operator decisions, incident reports, safety protocols, regulatory requirements.
cap2.whereToGetData: Machine learning models, decision logs, operator interfaces, compliance databases, audit trails.
cap2.whatToGetFrom: Confidence scores, override reasons, decision times, outcome feedback, learning patterns.
cap2.logic: Human oversight prevents AI errors. AI handles routine decisions, humans handle exceptions.
cap2.otherLogic: Could use consensus voting among multiple operators, or risk-based thresholds for automation levels.
cap2.purpose: Balance safety with efficiency, maintain human accountability, create auditable decision trails.

cap3.title: Proactive Environmental Conversion
cap3.description: Automated systems that detect hazards and convert environments to safe states before incidents occur.
cap3.whyThisFormula: Measures both success rate and speed while accounting for resource usage. Multiplicative ensures all factors matter.
cap3.dataSources: Hazard detectors, environmental sensors, control system status, energy consumption logs, maintenance records.
cap3.whereToGetData: Real-time monitoring systems, actuator feedback, power meters, HVAC controls, safety equipment logs.
cap3.whatToGetFrom: Hazard types and locations, system response times, environmental parameters, energy usage, success confirmations.
cap3.logic: Automated response is faster than human reaction. Multiple systems work in orchestration for comprehensive protection.
cap3.otherLogic: Could use predictive triggering based on patterns, or staged responses that escalate based on severity.
cap3.purpose: Transform reactive safety to proactive prevention, reduce incident severity, minimize downtime.

cap4.title: Performance Continuity Management
cap4.description: Continuous optimization ensuring safety, quality, and availability metrics remain within acceptable ranges over time.
cap4.whyThisFormula: Geometric product (∏) means any metric at zero makes whole index zero - all aspects are essential.
cap4.dataSources: KPI dashboards, incident databases, quality control records, uptime logs, cost tracking systems.
cap4.whereToGetData: Business intelligence systems, manufacturing execution systems, quality management software, financial systems.
cap4.whatToGetFrom: Trend data, benchmark comparisons, improvement rates, cost-benefit analyses, predictive indicators.
cap4.logic: Continuous small improvements prevent large failures. Interconnected metrics reveal systemic issues.
cap4.otherLogic: Could use control theory feedback loops, or game theory for optimizing multiple stakeholders.
cap4.purpose: Ensure long-term safety culture, optimize resource allocation, demonstrate ROI on safety investments.

sensor.title: Environmental Sensors Card
sensor.description: Monitors physical working conditions that affect both safety and productivity.
sensor.formula: Safety Score = 100 - Σ|Actual_i - Ideal_i| ÷ Range_i × Weight_i
sensor.whyThisFormula: Absolute deviation from ideal normalized by range, weighted by importance of each parameter.
sensor.dataSources: Temperature sensors, humidity sensors, air quality monitors, lux meters, sound level meters.
sensor.whereToGetData: Deployed IoT network, building management system, portable monitoring devices.
sensor.whatToGetFrom: Current readings, historical trends, calibration status, location context, alert thresholds.
sensor.logic: Comfortable workers are safer workers. Environmental extremes cause stress and errors.
sensor.otherLogic: Could use comfort indices like PMV, or predictive models based on weather forecasts.
sensor.purpose: Prevent environmental hazards, optimize working conditions, reduce fatigue-related incidents.

vision.title: Computer Vision Card
vision.description: AI-powered visual analysis for real-time safety compliance monitoring.
vision.whyThisFormula: Simple percentage captures compliance rate. Instance-based prevents gaming the system.
vision.dataSources: CCTV cameras, thermal imaging, depth sensors, edge computing devices, alert logs.
vision.whereToGetData: Existing security cameras, specialized safety cameras, mobile device feeds, drone footage.
vision.whatToGetFrom: Person detection, PPE classification, posture analysis, restricted area intrusion, unusual activity.
vision.logic: Visual monitoring scales better than human supervisors. Objective measurement eliminates bias.
vision.otherLogic: Could use privacy-preserving techniques like silhouette analysis, or federated learning for multi-site.
vision.purpose: Ensure PPE compliance, detect unsafe behaviors, monitor restricted areas, provide evidence for investigations.

process.title: Process Data Card
process.description: Real-time monitoring of equipment and operational parameters for predictive safety.
process.whyThisFormula: Weighted sum of deviations, with critical equipment having higher weight in overall score.
process.dataSources: PLC data, SCADA systems, vibration sensors, thermography, energy monitors, maintenance logs.
process.whereToGetData: Process control systems, equipment sensors, maintenance management software, energy management systems.
process.whatToGetFrom: Operating parameters, cycle counts, energy consumption, vibration patterns, temperature profiles.
process.logic: Equipment failures cause safety incidents. Predictive maintenance prevents unexpected failures.
process.otherLogic: Could use digital twin simulations, or physics-based models for failure prediction.
process.purpose: Prevent equipment-related incidents, optimize maintenance schedules, reduce unexpected downtime.

decision.title: Decision Matrix Card
decision.description: Tracks AI recommendations and human overrides for transparent decision audit trails.
decision.whyThisFormula: Simple accuracy metric. Can be weighted by decision importance or consequences.
decision.dataSources: AI model outputs, operator inputs, decision logs, outcome tracking, feedback mechanisms.
decision.whereToGetData: Decision support interface, operator consoles, incident management system, learning database.
decision.whatToGetFrom: Recommendation details, confidence scores, override reasons, decision times, outcome data.
decision.logic: Transparent decision-making builds trust. Learning from overrides improves AI over time.
decision.otherLogic: Could use A/B testing of decisions, or multi-armed bandit algorithms for optimization.
decision.purpose: Balance automation with human judgment, create auditable decision trails, improve AI through feedback.

control.title: Environmental Control Card
control.description: Automated systems that adjust physical environment to maintain safety conditions.
control.whyThisFormula: Multiplicative ensures all factors matter - can't optimize one at expense of others.
control.dataSources: Actuator positions, sensor feedback, energy meters, system status indicators, maintenance records.
control.whereToGetData: HVAC controls, lighting systems, ventilation equipment, emergency systems, power monitors.
control.whatToGetFrom: Current state vs target, response times, energy consumption, system health, maintenance needs.
control.logic: Automated control responds faster than humans. Integrated systems prevent conflicting actions.
control.otherLogic: Could use model predictive control, or reinforcement learning for adaptive optimization.
control.purpose: Maintain safe working environment, respond automatically to hazards, optimize energy usage.

grade.title: System Grading Card
grade.description: Quantitative assessment of safety system performance across multiple dimensions.
grade.formula: Overall Grade = Weighted_average(Safety×0.35, Data_quality×0.25, Completeness×0.20, Response×0.10, Learning×0.10)
grade.whyThisFormula: Safety gets highest weight (35%) as primary goal. Learning gets weight to encourage improvement.
grade.dataSources: All system metrics, incident reports, audit findings, user feedback, benchmark data.
grade.whereToGetData: Aggregated from all capabilities, external benchmarks, regulatory standards, historical performance.
grade.whatToGetFrom: Component scores, trend data, comparison benchmarks, improvement opportunities, root causes.
grade.logic: Quantitative grading enables objective comparison. Multi-dimensional prevents gaming single metric.
grade.otherLogic: Could use geometric mean, or minimum acceptable levels across all dimensions.
grade.purpose: Provide actionable performance metrics, enable benchmarking, drive continuous improvement.

safetyScore.title: Safety Score (A-)
safetyScore.description: Comprehensive measure of overall safety performance across personnel, environment, and equipment.
safetyScore.whyThisFormula: Personnel safety weighted highest (35%) as most important. Response gets 10% to value quick action.
safetyScore.dataSources: Incident reports, near-miss logs, safety observations, audit findings, sensor alerts, training records.
safetyScore.whereToGetData: EHS software, incident management systems, safety committee minutes, regulatory reports, sensor networks.
safetyScore.whatToGetFrom: Incident frequency and severity, hazard identification rates, compliance percentages, response times.
safetyScore.logic: Leading indicators (proactive) weighted with lagging indicators (reactive) for balanced view.
safetyScore.otherLogic: Could use Industry benchmarks (TRIR, DART), or risk-based weighting (high-risk areas count more).
safetyScore.purpose: Measure safety culture effectiveness, identify improvement areas, track progress over time.

dataQuality.title: Data Quality (B+)
dataQuality.description: Assessment of reliability, completeness, and timeliness of safety data used for decisions.
dataQuality.whyThisFormula: Accuracy weighted highest (25%) as most critical for decisions. All aspects contribute to overall quality.
dataQuality.dataSources: Sensor calibration records, data validation logs, system uptime reports, correlation analyses, audit trails.
dataQuality.whereToGetData: Data validation systems, sensor management platforms, system monitoring tools, quality control databases.
dataQuality.whatToGetFrom: Calibration status, missing data rates, data latency, cross-validation results, system availability.
dataQuality.logic: Garbage in, garbage out. Quality decisions require quality data. Multi-dimensional assessment prevents bias.
dataQuality.otherLogic: Could use Information Quality frameworks (IQM), or statistical measures like signal-to-noise ratio.
dataQuality.purpose: Ensure decisions based on reliable information, identify data collection gaps, maintain system credibility.

completeness.title: Completeness (C)
completeness.description: Measure of how comprehensively the safety system monitors all areas, hazards, and time periods.
completeness.whyThisFormula: Simple average of coverage areas. Equal weighting assumes all aspects equally important.
completeness.dataSources: System configuration maps, coverage audits, risk assessments, maintenance schedules, personnel tracking.
completeness.whereToGetData: Facility layouts, sensor deployment plans, risk registers, work schedules, access control systems.
completeness.whatToGetFrom: Monitored vs total area, detected hazard types, 24/7 coverage percentage, process coverage, personnel inclusion.
completeness.logic: Blind spots create risk. Comprehensive coverage ensures no area, hazard, or time period is unprotected.
completeness.otherLogic: Could use risk-weighted coverage (high-risk areas weighted more), or criticality-based assessment.
completeness.purpose: Identify monitoring gaps, prioritize expansion areas, ensure comprehensive protection.

thresholds.title: Human-in-Loop Threshold Settings
thresholds.description: Configurable parameters determining when system acts autonomously vs requesting human input.
thresholds.formula: Autonomy Level = f(Severity, Confidence, Complexity, Time_available)
thresholds.whyThisFormula: Multi-factor decision: High severity + high confidence + low complexity + limited time = higher autonomy.
thresholds.dataSources: Historical incident data, operator performance metrics, system confidence scores, response time requirements.
thresholds.whereToGetData: Decision logs, incident databases, operator assessment tools, system performance metrics, regulatory requirements.
thresholds.whatToGetFrom: Risk levels, confidence scores, decision complexity assessments, available response times, regulatory limits.
thresholds.logic: Balance safety (human oversight) with efficiency (automation). Dynamic thresholds adapt to conditions.
thresholds.otherLogic: Could use adaptive thresholds based on time of day, workload, or operator fatigue levels.
thresholds.purpose: Optimize human-machine collaboration, prevent automation overload, maintain appropriate oversight.

workflow.title: Decision Workflow
workflow.description: Step-by-step process from hazard detection to resolution, ensuring consistent response.
workflow.whyThisFormula: Considers both completeness (all steps done) and speed (time per step).
workflow.dataSources: Process logs, timing measurements, decision records, escalation trails, outcome tracking.
workflow.whereToGetData: Workflow management systems, process mining tools, time tracking, audit trails, outcome databases.
workflow.whatToGetFrom: Step completion rates, time between steps, decision points, escalation paths, outcomes.
workflow.logic: Standardized workflows ensure consistency. Measured steps enable optimization.
workflow.otherLogic: Could use process mining to discover actual vs designed workflows, or simulation for optimization.
workflow.purpose: Ensure consistent safety responses, identify process bottlenecks, enable continuous improvement.

conversion.title: Hazard-to-Safe Conversion
conversion.description: Process of automatically transforming hazardous conditions into safe environments.
conversion.whyThisFormula: Considers both success rate and duration of safe state. Product ensures both matter.
conversion.dataSources: Hazard detection logs, system action records, environmental monitoring, maintenance reports, energy usage.
conversion.whereToGetData: Incident management systems, control system logs, environmental sensors, energy management systems.
conversion.whatToGetFrom: Hazard types and locations, system responses, environmental changes, response times, energy costs.
conversion.logic: Automated conversion is faster than human response. Multiple systems work in coordination.
conversion.otherLogic: Could measure conversion quality (how safe), or resource efficiency (cost per conversion).
conversion.purpose: Prevent incidents through proactive intervention, minimize hazard duration, optimize resource usage.

kpi.title: KPI Scorecards
kpi.description: Key Performance Indicators tracking safety, quality, and availability metrics.
kpi.whyThisFormula: Percentage of target achieved, with cap preventing over-achievement in one area masking under-achievement elsewhere.
kpi.dataSources: Performance metrics, target settings, historical data, benchmark comparisons, improvement plans.
kpi.whereToGetData: Business intelligence systems, performance management software, regulatory reports, industry benchmarks.
kpi.whatToGetFrom: Current performance levels, target values, trends over time, benchmark comparisons, improvement rates.
kpi.logic: What gets measured gets managed. Balanced scorecard prevents optimization of one metric at expense of others.
kpi.otherLogic: Could use statistical process control limits, or dynamic targets based on capability.
kpi.purpose: Track performance against goals, identify improvement areas, demonstrate safety ROI.

prediction.title: Predictive Analytics
prediction.description: Forecasting future safety incidents and system performance based on historical patterns.
prediction.formula: Risk Probability = f(Historical_frequency, Current_trends, External_factors, System_condition)
prediction.whyThisFormula: Multi-factor prediction combines internal data with external context for more accurate forecasts.
prediction.dataSources: Historical incident data, trend analysis, external data (weather, market), system health metrics, maintenance schedules.
prediction.whereToGetData: Incident databases, trend analysis tools, external data feeds, system monitoring, maintenance planning.
prediction.whatToGetFrom: Historical patterns, current trends, external risk factors, system readiness, predictive confidence intervals.
prediction.logic: Past patterns predict future events. Multiple data sources improve prediction accuracy.
prediction.otherLogic: Could use machine learning models, or causal inference for root cause prediction.
prediction.purpose: Enable proactive prevention, optimize resource allocation, improve planning accuracy.

optimization.title: Continuous Optimization Loop
optimization.description: System that continuously improves safety performance through measurement, analysis, and adjustment.
optimization.whyThisFormula: Measures rate of improvement normalized by time. Accounts for both magnitude and speed of improvement.
optimization.dataSources: Performance metrics before/after changes, implementation logs, cost data, feedback mechanisms, learning records.
optimization.whereToGetData: Performance tracking systems, change management logs, cost accounting, feedback systems, learning databases.
optimization.whatToGetFrom: Baseline performance, post-change performance, implementation costs, learning outcomes, improvement sustainability.
optimization.logic: Continuous small improvements outperform occasional large changes. Closed-loop system ensures learning.
optimization.otherLogic: Could use control theory for stability, or reinforcement learning for adaptive optimization.
optimization.purpose: Drive continuous safety improvement, optimize resource allocation, embed learning into operations.
